text: Rocznik 2008. Próbowany w wersji beczkowej na otwarciu Stone Brewing Berlin. Piękna sprawa! Wnioskuję że piwo nic nie straciło z czasem, wręcz przeciwnie - doskonale się ułożyło. Silne nuty wanilii, drewna i bourbonu, mleczna czekolada, wysoka paloność, długi, intensywnie czekoladowy finisz. Bardzo gładkie, dość nisko wysycone, alkohol zamaskowany znakomicie. Klasa.
Thanks JC. Nice stuff, easy drinking for the strength. Not quite sure, plasticine, booze, marker pen, chocolate. Fruity. Nice.

2015 Fyodors Classic poured into a taster showing no head with thin translucent brown rims and pitch black center. 

The nose shows subdued bourbon and light caramel. 

The palate is full bodied and moderately carbonated with a strong alcoholic spice. Flavors of roasted malt forwardness and dark chocolate with bourbon on the mid-palate. Very light smoky bitterness on the finish.

TST/TWAT. Sampled from bottle at svartvits. Thanks to Maakun! Black with no head. Sweet deep roasted chocolate malts, dark fruit, blackberries, prune, bourbon, vanilla, licorice, burnt marshmallow, mild spices. Big sweet, over moderate bitter. Full body, bit dry and low carbonation. Nice balls out stout.
Bottle shared at TST/TWAT. Pours black with almost no head. Chocolate malts, roast, molasses, vanilla, oak, light fruity note. Medium sweet, under medium bitter. Over medium body, low carbonation.

Bottle shared at The Sweetest Tasting. Black with short lasting light brown head. Lots of chocolate, vanilla, toffee, marzipan, some nuts and berries, cinnamon, tobacco, dry oak tannins. Over medium sweet and under medium bitter. Full bodied. Nice stuff.
Glad to finally try this. Bought at the Liberty Station brewery. Great aromas and flavors of roasted malt, chocolate, hops and whiskey. Very dark and somewhat thick. Smooth and a good sipper.

Bottle. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty woody bourbon chocolate aroma. Roasted malty woody chocolate bourbon vanilla flavor. Has a roasted malty woody vanilla bourbon chocolate finish.
Poured deep dark brown with a frothy beige head. Aroma of vanilla smoothness, roast malt, light smooth berries. Medium to full body, flavour as the aroma,lightly bitter.

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2016 Poured from bottle thanks Willrunforbeer dark cola pour with no head and nice lacing. Aromas of dark chocolate roasty malt caramel vanilla oak and alcohol. Taste is rich and creamy nice chewy mouth feel licorice dark fruit chocolate and bourbon. Wow.

Bottle, 0,5l, vintage 2015, batch#1, 13%abv: pours oily black, with (surprisingly!?!!!) longlasting creamy light brown head. Aroma: intense dark and roasted malts, which takes on chocolate, cocoa nibs, mokka, supported with dark fruits esters, venilla, oak, leather, bourbon...flavor: very similar to aroma: intense roasted barley, dark malts flavors, which takes on espresso coffee, dark & milk chocolate, cacao nibs, tosted toffee, hint of caramel, supported with dark fruits esters (cherries, prunes, blueberries...), with slightly piny, floral, spicy hop notes and with vanilla, bourbon....finish is dry, slightly sticky & sourish of roasted malts/barley...body is full/thick, texture creamy, velvetly, carbonation low to moderate medium. Classical / old school BA RIS; simply but very enjoyable.

As Fyodors Classic, 2012 (?). Aroma of licorice, chocolate, caramel, bourbon, spice, light boozee. Taste of chocolate, licorice, vanilla, bourbon, soy sauce, umami. Okay BA Stout, expected a lot more.
Klassisch. Perfekt und der Maßstab aller Dinge. DAS BIER!!! 0,15/3,30 FASS. STONE BREWERY BERLIN.

500 ml bottle, 2015 series. The beer is black, pretty much to the edge of the glass. Head is brown and very small; fizzles off quickly. The aroma has a fairly heavy roast flavor. Theres a moderate level of chocolate and lots of caramel. Light vanilla, oak and spice from the barrel. Some alcohol burn present. The taste is sweet, lots of toasty caramel maltiness. Light fruitiness from the roast. Light bitterness in the finish from the oak. A little too much roast and caramel, as opposed to fudginess, for me. Fairly hot. Round, soft mouthfeel, sorta slick though. Not bad, not great.

Tap at Stone Berlin. 2008, 10,5%, 65IBU. Pours full black and opaque with small tan and creamy head. Intense nose with strong but smooth bourbon note, licorice, dark chocolate and dark berries. Starts light sweet, but becomes medium bitter dry soon. Exceptionally well balanced and harmonic taste. Full thick body with medium carbonation and very smooth creamy mouthfeel. Flavor is very complex, at the forefront there is bourbon, with chocolate and licorice, in the back it is spicy with vanilla and fruity with dark berries and a hint of plum. Well balanced yet distinctive profile. Gets a bit warm in the end, but hides the alcohol well. Leaves a light bitter dry aftertaste with bourbon and chocolate notes.

500 mL bottle shared with ebone1988. 2014 vintage coming in at 13.9%. The pour is a little thin. Its a light black with a medium khaki colored head that falls to a thinner ring with a couple spots of lace. The aroma is pretty good. There are equal parts chocolate, vanilla, bourbon barrel, and a hefty booze to it as well. This is pretty complex, yet the alcohol controls the back end. The flavor is really good. Vanilla, chocolate, barrel, molasses, and everything you want in a nice barreled stout. The barrel is a little heavy on the finish. The mouth feel is lighter, pretty thin actually, with a strange carbonation and a lingeringly sweet chocolate and bourbon on the back end. Its pretty good, but there is definitely some lacking characteristics here.

Bottle shared with koleminer20. As "Fyodors Classic." Vintage 2014. Aroma is bourbon, roasted malt, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, booze, barrel. Appearance is black, light tan head, poured a touch thin. Taste is bourbon, barrel, roasted malt, coffee, vanilla, roasty and good. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, barrel roasted malt marshmallow aftertaste. Overall, I expected more but this is nice.
Prachtig zwart. Heerlijke ba geur. Heerlijk! Vol, veel smaak, bourbon. Topper!
A: Deep dark brown/black with a thin brown lacing. N: Vanilla, chocolate, coffee T: Vanilla, bourbon, coconut, chocolate O: Wow! Extremly well balanced BA!

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2016 500ml bottle, Fyodors Classic at Jameys. Brewed June 2, 2014; aged 7 months in American Oak Kentucky Bourbon Barrels; Vintage 2015, batch #1; alc. 13%. Pours a very dark brown, almost black with a tan head. Aroma is sweet, saddle, some vanilla and oak notes in the background. Taste is sweet, with vanilla, oak, leather, roasted malt notes. Candied plums and even some chewing gum notes. Very unusual aftertaste, but decent :-)

Aroma of chocolate, caramel and vanilla.
Flavor of bourbon, charred oak with some vanilla. Chocolate. 
Mouthfeel is thick. No trace of alcohol. Goes down extremely well.
Mooie zwarte kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt zoetig, vol, vanille, crème. Mooie volle geur. Smaakt vol vanille, koffie, crème. Mooie volle afdronk.
Zwart bier met een kleine bruine kraag. Ruikt bourbon, vanille, overrijp fruit. Smaakt vanille, overrijp fruit, bourbon, geroosterd, bitter.
Dark black. Thin head. Chocolate. Oily. Not sure why this is top 50. Oak. Very drinkable. Tasted at my Outdoor bottle share. Thx robertdale!

Sampled at a tasting. Pitch black pour, thin espresso head. Smells like bourbon, maple syrup, espresso, caramel and coconut. Tastes like bourbon, chocolate, cocoa, dark cherries, vanilla and coconut. Soft mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Black color with brown head. Aroma has bourbon, fudge, chocolate, vanilla and toasted coconut, everything you would want from a bourbon barrel aged RIS. Taste starts slightly sweet with fudge and bourbon but the finish is dark, roasty and bitter. Medium-heavy body, smooth carbonation, a bit of alcohol warmth on the aftertaste. Really nice one, very well made, tasty and balanced.

Bottle shared by weihenweizen. Thanks! The beer pours a dense black with a khaki head of foam. The aroma has mostly bourbon, fudge, and hazelnuts. Big sweetness in the taste along with some boozy chocolate. Thick, syrupy mouthfeel. Lower carbonation.

Refrigerated 0.5 L brown bottle poured into a snifter. Black with small beige head. Aroma is beatiful bourbon, medium body, lower carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is nice bourbon, chocolate, and some herbal hop balance.
One of Stones best beers, always a treat. It trails what I consider to be world class BBA stouts (like Parabola and Bourbon County) but still a very delicious beer.
Fyodors classic bottle. A bit disappointing, Think, lacking in the chocolate and roast of normal IRS. A bit better when it warmed.
2013. Trade with Amkang. Thanks Albert. Pours black with a small off beige head. Kentucky Wood, Vanilla, roast, coffee , Tobacco and slight oxidation. Slick, mega soft and chewy body. Stunning..

That sweet bourbon, cocoa, malty smell is incredible! Truly one of the best smelling beers ever! I had the 2014 13% ABV version and I have to say it is incredible. Light brown head, dark as hell color, the sweet malty taste, with that incredible good burn on the swallow. This is a big boy stout though, that 13% will kick you in the ass. If you like hardcore, heavy stouts, grab two of these, one to enjoy now and one to cellar.

Tasted from bottle. Pours black with dark brown head that fades quickly. Aroma is dark chocolate and coffee, slight bourbon. Taste is moderate bitterness with a nice sweet malt backbone. Well balanced and complex. Flavors of coffee, chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, caramel, maple syrup. Excellent imperial stout. Definitely one of best. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The base beer is my favorite RIS so I may be a bit biased but this is a pretty awesome beer. The bourbon barrel notes are extremely balanced and add to the wonderful complexity that is stones RIS. Pours pitch black with a beige head that disipates quickly leaving a ring of small bubbles clinging to the edges of the snifter. The smell is filled with vanilla, coconut, sweet cherries, and an oak bourbon flavor. The flavor has some cocoa, vanilla, anise and bourbon. Theres a good balance of sweetness from the barrels and bitterness from the base beer. The beer is very thick with a slight boozy sting on the tongue. The only thing I could hope for is version with espresso or chocolate to pump up those flavors because they didnt seem very pronounced in the beer

Bottle pour at the source. Pour it Black. Nearly black with a light brown head. Aroma is dark chocolate, coffee, bourbon, oak. Flavor is dark chocolate, over extracted coffee, a hint of coconut, bourbon, oak. Very tasty and smooth.

500 ml bottle (as Fydors Classic, 2014) from IP trade with richiesd, thanks! Pitch black color. Big brown head, quickly disappearing. Aromas: bourbon, red fruit, chocolate, roast, wood. Retronasal its sweet, bourbon, chocolate, wood, alcohol, vanilla, light red fruit. Flavor is moderate to full sweet, chocolate. Strong alcohol feel. Medium to full body. Long finish with chocolate, light roast, moderate bitterness.

Bottle: Poured a pitch-black color stout with a small dark brown foamy head with minimal retention or lacing. Aroma of light roasted malt, black chocolate with some strong vanilla and bourbon notes with some woody notes also perceptible. Taste is also dominated by strong bourbon notes and vanilla which mix in well with the black chocolate and light roasted malt notes. Woody notes and residual sugar notes re also perceptible. Body is full with nice creamy texture with low carbonation and some warming alcohol is present. World-class barrel-aged stout!

Bottle, on my birthday. Black and thick, pecan colored head fades to a skiff. Aroma is bourbon, vanilla, cookies, plums and cherries, brown sugar, molasses, chocolate. Taste is vanilla, cookies, brown sugar, chocolate, toasted barley, cream, coffee, burnt sugar. Palate is rich and smooth, carbonation subdued. Finish is not quite dry, with a hint of salt. This is sublime, balanced, touch of sweet, almost dry.
Bottle labeled Fyodors Classic black thin tan head and spotty lacing rich bud on and chocolate aromas and flavors heavy slick feel rich and lovely

500 ml bottle as Fyodors Classic. 2014 vintage. Enjoyed at San Diego, CA. Pours a black colour with a minimal white head. Aroma of roasted malts, wooden tartness, vanilla and syrup. Flavour of strong roastiness, bourbon, vanilla, wooden tartness, syrup and dark chocolate. Full bodied. Long, warming, wooden finish. Really well balanced.

50 cl bottle @ hotel room, San Diego. 2015 series, batch #1.
Pours black color with a small beige head. Nice bourbon aroma, toasted malts, vanilla notes, some caramel malts and subtle licorice. Vanilla flavor, bourbon sweetness, caramel malts, chocolate, some ripe fruit sweetness too. Subtle alcohol burn at the end, some wooden tanginess. The sweetness complements the high alcohol content nicely. Quite pleasant and balanced bourbon IS.
5426

500ml bottle from Stone Tap Room, San Diego, CA
As Fyodors Classic, 2015 batch #1 - Pours pitch black with a smalle white head. Aroma of roasty malts, bourbon, wood, vanilla, toffee, oak, coffee, dark chocolate and cocoa. Taste is smooth, complex, sweetish and roasty with loads of bourbon, wood, oak, vanilla, toffee, coffee, cocoa and dark chocolate. Finish is smooth, heavy and complex with loads of vanilla, oak, wood, bourbon and toffee. Quite balanced and tasty bourbon IS.

50 cl bottle vintage 2014, "2015 series batch 01" @ hotel room, San Diego. Aroma is sweet with bourbon and vanilla tones. Also some licorice. Flavour has wood, sweet bourbon tones, licorice and mild coffee tones. Also hints of ash. Very typical bourbon-IS; a clean and very drinkable though.
Bottle. One of the best beers Ive ever had. Pours an opaque black with tan head. Aroma and taste of roasted malts, coffee, wood, and bourbon.
Bottle. Black beer with a low tan head. Bourbon and chocolate aroma. Bourbon and chocolate flavor with vanilla. Medium bodied. Bourbon and chocolate linger with vanilla.

500 mL bottle poured into a snifter. Deep black body. Nearly inky. Small khaki head. Thin collar and a few wisps. Dark chocolate. Fudgy. Bourbon is secondary, but quickly becomes dominant. Sharp oak. Lots of vanilla. Taste is bitter chocolate right up front. Oak amplifies it. Bourbon builds. Slight sweetness, but its overpowered by oak and bitter chocolate. Thick. Medium carbonation. A step above other Bourbon stouts. The quality of the base beer truly impresses.

2015, 500ml bottle enjoyed @ my parents house. Pours very dark brown with a tiny and quick fading brown head. Aroma is bourbon, roasted malt, coffee, caramel, salty liquorice, wood, vanilla and dark fruits. Flavour is sweet and salty. Full bodied, thick texture, soft carbonation. Finish bourbon, wood and roasted malt.
Bottle. Black with tan head. Aroma of vanilla, coconut, roasty chocolate. Taste of vanilla, coconut, bourbon, chocolate, roasty. Decent body with a clean finish. Perfectly balanced.

500ml bottle, from trade with RobertDale. Thank you Bob! I m celebrating my 35th birthday with this one. Black color with small beige brown head. Malty aroma, chocolate, dark dried fruits, plums, some butter, wood, vanilla, alcohol. Sweet and light bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

500 ml bottle 2015 vintage shared by AdamJax, much hanks buddy! Black with very thin tan head. Aroma is a sweet bold bourbon with chocolate, burnt coffee, with a very light licorice note. The flavor shows the strong bourbon flavor without much alcohol or overly boozy hints. The body is full and thick with a brownie batter chewy character. The over 10% really doesnt show much at all. Anymore rambling about this stout is pointless, can say anything else that hasnt already been said. Top tier and I was so happy to have tried this, awesome BBA stout! Thanks to Stone for putting this in a bottle, no matter the cost.

Small head on the pour and faded fast. Pitch black but not dense. The smells is very sweet.not all that boozy. licorice, milk chocolate, dark chocolate, some spices. Bourbon presence is there, not boozy, just really present. Its sweet, malty, boozy but yeah some age would be nice but its not too intense. Very roasty and a ton of chocolate. Well integrated whiskey. I think it could use some time but its a very unique beer.

Bottle 2013 vintage "fydors Classic". Appearance is black motor oil with light mocha head. Aroma is huge notes of oak, bourbon soaked graham crackers, vanilla, and roasted malts. Taste is rich vanilla, chocolate, oak, roasted malts, extremely well integrated. This is world class, lots of barrel, lots of base beer, and man is it ever smooth drinking. Wow.

May 23, 2015. #2100. Bottle at home as Fyodors Classic batch #3 2014 release, 13,9%. Received in a trade with rlgk, thanks Ronny! 
Black with a small brown head. Aroma is lots of bourbon, vanilla, dark chocolate, licorice, molasses, light burnt sugar. Taste is sweet toffee, vanilla, bourbon, warming alcohol, bitter dark chocolate. Finish is warming alcohol, bourbon, toffee and lasting roasted bitterness. Medium to full bodied, creamy and a bit oily texture, soft carbonation.

500ml bottle 2014 vintage (b2) pours dark oily black brown with 2 finger mocha head. Nose is dusty vanilla bourbon spice, licorice and dark fruit, cocoa. Taste is medium bodied, a little lighter bodied than expected, dusty cocoa, bakers chocolate, dark fruit, vanilla, bourbon spice, moderate sweetness, a bit boozy. Finishes with boozy bittersweet chocolate, cocoa dust, vanilla, whiskey spice, licorice.

Dark brown with a light chocolate head. Aroma is bourbon, chocolate, molasses, raisins, dates, fig. Full bodied, creamy mouthfeel, sweet and reasonably well balanced on the palate with a warming finish. Taste is sweet bourbon, molasses, raisins, dates, fig, subtle hint of anise.

Fyodors Classic 2015. Bottle poured to snifter. Reddish/brownish black. No head. No lacing. Aroma is slight bourbon, coffee, vanilla, stone fruit, cherries, dark chocolate, dark roasted malt. Flavor is fantastic. Big but balanced. Follows the aroma. Hides the big abv. Fantastic.
Smell is malt and sweet bourbon. Taste is pretty much the same. Full body, medium carbonation, and very slight foam.

When you read that a beer has an ABV of 13.9%, "smooth" is not the word you expect to use when describing it. Yet, thats exactly Fyodors Classic is: a masterwork of balance. With a nose that reveals as much cherry, currant, and plum as it does roasted malt, bourbon, and oak, you know that Stones barrel-aged creation is going to be one-of-a-kind. And it is. Dark fruits (especially cherry), caramel, bittersweet chocolate, and the sweeter aspects of bourbon. While this Stout wasnt particularly heady (a side effect of all the booze and the age), there was a lot of goodness packed into its darkness. This is an Imperial Russian Stout that is worthy of Dostoyevskys name.

(Thanks Stefan, "StefanSD")

Bottle.

A- Bourbon, boozy, dark fruits, cherries, oak, milk chocolate.

A- Black color, black liquid, brown head.

T- Bourbon, oak, cocoa, vanilla, dark fruits.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, smooth boozy finish.

O- First off, I hated Stone RIS. In fact it is one of my lowest RIS beers rated so far. So I was a little apprehensive with this. A 2014 bottle labeled as Fyodors Classic. Holy shit. This was phenomenal. Tons and tons of bourbon but not abrasive. Somehow a 14% beer went down smoother than about anything Ive ever had. So balanced and complex and easy to drink. How I wish I had more of this!

Fyodors Classic 2015 Batch 1. Pours pitch black with a creamy mocha head. Aroma is heavy in chocolate, coffee, and black liquorice. Taste is sweet and malty with a nice bitterness to balance it out. Full bodied and smooth and creamy on the palate with lively carbonation. A really nice imperial stout that I wish I could have aged for a year or two but unfortunately could not.

Bought at Liberty Station and consumed in Calgary. A bottle can be corked and last for 2+ days. Dark imperial stout with a hint of soy sauce. Aroma is big dark and beautiful with lots of dark fruit, molasses and unspiced Christmas. Smooth, dark, intoxicating nectar.

Fyodors Classic 2015 series batch number 1. Pours a jet black motor oil color with a rather short lived brown head. The aroma had notes of roasted coffee, milk chocolate, caramel, vanilla, with minor notes of toffee. The flavor was of roasted coffee, milk chocolate, with earthy notes and minor notes of caramel and booze. It goes down real smooth with slightly sweet aftertaste. Overall I think I have new favorite Stone brew.

Rich bubbly tan head a dark pour medium carbonation aromas the bourbon is superbly sharp milky like chocolate rich fruits molasses liquorice body already shows roast coffee so rich caramel currants raisins the flavours bliss so lovely velvet like bourbon taste malt chocolate richness medium bitter taste of coffee raisins currants plums liquorice caramel excellent balance wonderful body sharp flavours moist dark fruits the oak vanilla touch the finish excellent barrelling lovely sweetness a big winner for the brewery lasting fruit and roasted bitter goodness bourbon taste just so good on the palate

UPDATED: APR 21, 2015 2014 vintage Stone RIS aged in bourbon barrels . Opaque and black as a moonless midnight. Light brown hues along the edges of the glass and even after an aggressive pour only a couple bubbles rise to the surface. No lacing. Heavy bittersweet chocolate dominate the aroma with bourbon also detectable. Ridiculous flavors of baker?s chocolate, vanilla, possibly some oak, and whiskey tantalize the palate. Medium bodied, though close to full, brew with a smooth and creamy mouthfeel and perfect sweetness balancing the bitterness. Wonderfully crafted bourbon barrel aged russian imperial stout by Stone that will satisfy those with a desire for well hidden big bold alcoholic stouts and those with a sweet tooth. Well done! Awesome!

Dark thick black pour from a corked 500ml bottle. Tan head. Big bourbon and malt nose. Hot bourbon goodness. Intense bourbon and roasted malt, still good hop character and some bitter coffee notes in the finish.

Bottle at Beermongers Event. Under Fyodors Classic.

A: Pure black, thin ring of mocha head with swirls on top of the stout, and legs.

N: Huge black licorice. Dominating, really. Big coffee, raisin, currant, cocoa, and roast as the semi-majority shareholders. Bourbon is less pronounced, though it lends a touch of coconut, vanilla, and caramel. Oak is less noticeable, however. 

T: Very sweet, slightly bitter, not cloying.

M: Oily, heavy body. Foaming, tickling carbonation. Hidden alcohol.

O: An impressive dark fruit rendition of the IRS. 4 oz is a meal in and of itself, though I have to admit, this goes down fairly smoothly. If the anise flavors werent so far out of control, Id mark it up much higher, but as it is, I dont think it quite competes with the upper tier of the style.

Bottle at Stone @ SAN. 2015 series, batch 01 brewed June 2, 2014. 7 months in Kentucky bourbon barrels, bottled March 2015. Pitch black. Silky aroma of bourbon, wood, coffee, chocolate, raisin, and currant. Taste is sweet and a blast of bitterness. Palate is all that is good in this world.
Bottle shared at Anchorage Apr 15 Tasting: Poured dark brown with reddish edges, tan head. Aroma was strong vanilla and bourbon. Taste was sweet vanilla, malts, and alcohol bourbon burn.

'13 vintage bottle. The pour is black. The aroma is sweet, sweet bourbon, so nice of a nose. The taste is bold and smooth at the same time. An underrated bb stout. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle thanks to Bursprak! Pours pitch black with a medium dark brown head. Aromas of coconut, dark chocolate, fudge, vanilla, espresso, some licorice. Taste is espresso, coconut, vanilla, fudge, caramel, dark chocolate, some bitter notes, light heat, roast, dry woody finish.

February 2014 bottle. Black mild tan foam. Aroma is marshmallow, mild oak, bourbon, sweetness. Taste is sweetness up front, chocolate, prunes, bourbon, mild vanilla, dry finish. You can see the base beer coming through here. Full palate without being chewy, strong carbonation. Probably pound for pound the most solid bourbon barrel aged stout Ive had. Lacks a wow factor nor is it extremely memorable but it very drinkable and well balanced.

Pour on tap, thick black pour with dark tan head, aroma is bursting with dark fruit, brownie, coffee into a bit of dark chocolate, some roasted malt into a bit of bourbon, oak in there with a touch of vanilla. Taste was a mix of bourbon, slight espresso into some vanilla, touch of chocolate into some dark fruit, slight anise as well, some oaky, vanilla tones, finishing sweet, bourbon forward. Nice addition to a great base.

2014 vintage. Pours black and oily..thin Mocha head. Aromas of char, oak and bourbon. Nice mouthfeel...creamy...but hot! Roasted notes calm the bourbon and oak. Nice hop bitterness. ..finishes sticky with a clinging sweetness and big vanilla oak. Tasty.

Part of blind tasting BA Imperial Stout tasting. 
I cant believe I actually enjoyed this, I thought I was completely though with Stone. Dark head with light rubbing alcohol on the nose. Lots of dark chocolate syrup and cocoa. Not sugary or sticky, not bitter or alcohol laden, are we sure this is Stone?
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: Bottled as Fyodors Classic. Aged about 1 year. Thick black pour with almost no head. Aroma is huge chocolate, moderate coffee bean and oak, some vanilla, burnt caramel, and molasses. Tastes so awesome. Might be the smoothest BB beer Ive had. Rich, sweet chocolate cake and caramel candy countered with vanilla and oak. Just a hint of booze. Some light coffee shows up when warmed. Medium to full body. Great beer.

Bottle thanks to Bursprak for this long time want. Pours black with a brown lacing. Aroma of chocolate, vanilla, sweet bourbon quality, coconut, roasted malts and coffee The taste has chocolate, caramel, vanilla, liquorice, wood and a decent amount of heat from the alcohol. End is really dry. This was good and tasty but maybe a bit too hot for me without the proper sweetness to really back it up. Guess I prefer the original. Still very good!

Bottle from a trade, thanks rlgk. Pour is pitch black with a small espresso head. Nose has light bourbon, roast, tar, soy, licorice and some light coffee. Taste is alike, light bourbon, smooth, salty licorice, fresh coffee, oily, ash with a dry finish. I appreciate the subtle bourbon notes on this one.

Bottle at the source. Pitch black with dark brown head. Aroma is bourbon, brownie batter, light toffee, and light raisin. Taste is hot medium sweet and roasty. Very rich and nicely creamy. Great beer.

50cl bottle with huge thanks to Bursprak!! Pours an oily pitch black with a medium sized, brown, short lasting head. Aroma has just lots of bourbon! Coco nut, butter, vanilla, lots of dark dried fruits, but also some more fresh, dark berry like fruits, big, dry chocolate aroma, coffee, slight licorice and quite a bit of roast! Taste is very sweet up front, but has lots of dry notes with both a slightly burning alcohol, dry bourbon character, dark, dry chocolate and a huge vanilla and buttery bourbon finish. Body is very full, but lots of dry notes balances it out greatly! lots of heat as well. Medium low carbonation.
knocking off another top 50. Bottle purchased in liberty station - Stone. Fantastic bourbon abeer with a great body. Lots of sweet roasty malts. Tasty stuff.
500ml bottle. Nice fresh oak, bourbon, light vanilla, burnt malt, chocolate, mod carbonation, full body, bitter, brownie, becomes a bit sweet, mellow finish, tasty.

Dark black in color with beige head... Aroma of rich caramel, vanilla, dark chocolate... Flavor is incredibly smooth for 14%, lots of bourbon barrel notes but not too hot... Dark fruits, chocolate, vanilla... Bourbon finish... Really nice 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2014 Fyodors bottle. Damn fine beer, but its just a bit strong for 8 am on a Saturday morning. WEll concocted with lots of anise and a touch of whiskey. My only complaint is that its just too sweet. Looking forward to a shot of insulin. Kompai mates

Bottle shared with friends. Bottled as fyodors classic 2014 batch 3. Poured a dark black colour with a small tanned head on top. Sweet dark chocolate, bourbon, raisins, carmel, dark toasted espresso, dark forrest fruits, anise, vanilla, licorice. Awesome full flavoured beer! Thick and shewy mouthfeel

Bottle at Liberty Station. Pours dark brown with a bubbly tan head. Tastes like sweet syrup, bourbon, woody, chocolate, light smoke. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like syrup, chocolate, bourbon, wood, light smoke.
Shared bomber to snifters. The usual huge roasted deliciousness that is Stone IRS lies beneath a sticky vanilla bourbon barrel sweetness.

Bomber via Stefanje the magnanimous. Lurked in the fridge foe a good long while until i could get my proper venue. CreMy and big bodied. This was a welcome break during the drywalling/mudding extravaganza. Shared with the boys. Bourboun is mellow and must be pulled from glass. Boozy and you know it. Totay enjoyable. Woo hoo!

Flaske: Perfekt nytårsøl. Kulsort og meget olieret med en fantastisk duft af bourbon. I forhold til procenterne og udseendet er øllen meget frisk og let i tyngden hvilket gør den ekstrem drikbar. I det hele taget et mesterværk. Købt i Californien hos Stone i sommers.

Bottle at the Portland Holiday Ale Fest 2014. Nice score, Preston! Colour...pretty much solid black, except for the thin tan head. Nose...heaps of dark chocolate and malted milk balls, with oaky Bourbon notes and wisps of cafe au lait. Palate...quite viscous and heavily chocolated with more of the malted milk ball flavours. The feel is quite plush and lightly cloying, though the oak tempers the sweetness very well and does not allow the sugars to take over entirely. The back palate is dry, with more quercus and notes of Bourbon balls.

Bottle from StefanSD, MANY many MANY thanks for this one, this is a great beer. Pours deep brown color, beige head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, plums, dark berries, hints of alcohol. Taste is sweet, chocolate, coffee, plums, dark berries, warming alcohol, some caramel, vanilla, bourbon, cherries.

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2014 Bottle as Stone Fyodors Classic, kindly shared by MisoW and StefanSD, huge thanks, guys. Almost black color with thick beige head. Roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla, licorice in aroma. Taste, dark malt, chocolate, coffee beans, vanilla, cocoa butter, licorice, prunes. Alcohol is dangerously hidden. Long coffee and chocolate bitter finish. Extremely tasty.

Bottle: Thanks, Jason. Pours black, viscous & thick like motor oil with a leathery tan head that doesnt form until a good 6 or 7 seconds after the hard pour. Comes & goes quick. Lovely aroma of thick, fat fudge & chocolate cake batter. The shit your grandma whips up for special occasions. Rich bourbon barrel warmth & a nice bit of spicy oak. Getting huge notes of coconut & vanillin from the barrel, too. The barrel aging is integrated exceedingly well. Brownie batter BOMB on the palate. Dark chocolate brownies, dense fudge, moderate black licorice, smooth bourbon, woody vanilla, dried & toasted coconut, charred oak, & a bit of roasted, ashy malt. Very small touch of dark prune sweetness. Finishes with mostly notes of bourbon lathered fudge. Thick & creamy body... This is great. Stone should really make this a yearly (or somewhat regular) release... Yum.

Courtesy of Jason R
Bottle: The aroma consists of moderate-heavy chocolate, maple syrup, vanilla, coconut, bourbon, and faint coffee. It pours a dark brown with some faint orange highlights. It has a small beige head that quickly fades to a minimal film outlined by a very fine ring. The flavor starts with moderate milk chocolate with a touch of molasses and caramel. The finish has light-moderate coconut, light coffee, bourbon, vanilla, and a hint of licorice. Its medium-full bodied with mild carbonation.
Bottle. Jet black in color with a perfect creamy tan head. Aroma is milk chocolate and bourbon, vanilla candy bar. Taste is absolutely dreamy. Silky smooth and loads of chocolate and wood.

Bottle to glass. Pours a pitch black color with a thin creamy brown head. Aroma is a potent roasted malts, huge bourbon, vanilla, chocolate. Flavor much of the same. Big chocolate, bourbon, roasted malt sweetness. Big beer, big body. Delicious.

As "Stone Fyodors Classic" 2013 Stone Imperial Russian Stout, Bourbon. 2014 Series Batch no 03, 38 IBU. Marked 13.9% ABV. Bottled Feb 2014.Bottled 500 ml, at rlgk + Aniela tasting, USA comes to Göteborg 2014, on October 18, 2014.Thanks to rlgk + Aniela!Black color, small dark brown head. Sweet, raisin, alcohol, roasted, vanilla scent. Roasted, sweet, chocolate taste. Chocolate, roasted aftertaste. Warming alcohol. Medium to smooth mouthfeel, medium bitterness.

Black as the darkest dungeon. Ok beige head. Mellow and fine aroma with oak, espresso and vanilla. Full body. Well balance between sweetness and bitterness. Well maybe a bit over to the sweet side. Booozy. Bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, raisins and mild acidic. Powerful lovely ale.[Bottle at rlgk plaza]

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2014 Bottle courtesy of rlgk. Pours hazy black with a rather small blackish brown head that quickly dissipates while leaving some small trace on the glass. Smell is sweet and malty with roasted malts, burnt caramel, toffee, vanilla fudge, dark chocolate, coffee, charred wood, moist soil, toasted nuts, hay, alcohol and liquorice fudge. Taste is sweet, tiny bitter and malty with roasted malts, burnt caramel, toffee, vanilla fudge, charred wood coconut milk, dark chocolate, dark roast coffee, moist soil and alcohol. Mouthfeel is soft, round, silky, tiny boozy and near full bodied. Finish is tiny sweet, bitter and malty with roasted malts, burnt caramel, toffee, vanilla fudge, charred wood, coconut milk, bourbon, dark chocolate, dark roast coffee and moist soil. Excellent! Very pleasant nicely executed barrel aged imperial stout. Prominent barrel treatment without it hiding the great base beer.

Flaska på provningen USA comes to Göteborg 2014.

Bottle @ rlgk. Pours jet black with a small tanned head. Aroma is sweet roasted malty coffee chocolate. Flavor is as aroma very drinkable a bit acidy and pungent eith balanced bitterness and a surprising sweet aftertaste

Sweet boozy aroma. Hot finish but not disagreeable. Rich chocolate powder flavor. A little bland at times. Nice oily mouthfeel. Not as roasty as regular stone IRS. Fun, but nothing stands out. Doesnt merit the work it might take to get one.

vintage 2014.

aroma: kbs or bourbon county. cant decide. more specific: leather and chocolate; cinnamon in there, too. appearance: dark black, quickly dissipating tan to dark brown head. taste: cocoa powder, cinnamon, some cola/cardamom and bourbon burn. palate: very velvety.

"2006 - a little past its prime, so the hops didnt really add to it at all, but damn, the roasted malts and chocolate, anise, etc in this beer aged in bourbon barrels? A thing of beauty. Would really like to try this a year or two old instead of 6. 
2014 as Fyodors Classic 500 ml bottle...soft luxurious palate aroma and flavor, just like guradians slumber. AWESOME! "
Bottle @ RBBSG III. Pours black, small beige head. Aroma is dominated by vanilla and chocolate. Taste is very sweet, vanilla and more chocolate. Huge stout, lovely.

500ml bottle (Fyodor classic) with a big thanks to Darrel. Pours out a thick rich silky black topped with a ring of a brown head. Nose is roast malts chocolate coffee bourbon barrel goodness vanilla and some sweetness. Taste is just as wonderful as the nose. All of the classic bourbon barrel goodness along with a great rich taste.

500 ml. bottle. Batch 3. Pours a thick black with a small brown head. Great aroma of bourbon, malt, chocolate, and vanilla. Taste is bourbon, roasted malt, dark chocolate, vanilla, and coffee. Hides the alcohol content very well. Rich and creamy. Superb!!
Bottle as Fyodor classic. Pours black brown head. Nose/taste of bourbon, oak, vanilla, roast chocolate. Medium body.

500ml bottle (Fyodors Classic - batch 3) in a tulip. Pours black with a lacy, beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, bourbon and oak and vanilla, chocolate and hints of coffee, some light sweetness, and some hints of dark fruits. Flavor the same with an incredible blend of the base beer and bourbon. Thick texture. A really good beer; glad I finally got to try it.

Bottle from a friend. Smell is strong bourbon and some cherries. A deep complex smell which strong and sweet. Pours black with a medium brown head. Taste is very smooth and very drinkable. Some dark chocolates and some bourbon. Overall a really good beer which delivers a strong nice taste in a smooth way.

Batch 3 bottle shared at Monkey Paw. Pitch black pour with thin mocha head. Nose is a roasted, malty, barrel bomb with hints of dark chocolate, vanilla, and coffee. Taste follows the nose but is a little too boozy for now. Plan to try another bottle in my cellar in about a year. Really well done though.

Aroma: wonderful creamy bourbon with vanilla and cigar
Appearance : black with reddish brown head
Taste: Sweet salted caramel maltiness and incredibly smooth. Finish has a pleasant burst of bourbon and vanilla goodness
Overall: An elite version of a bourbon barrel imperial stout with the bourbon being the clear hero here but not in overpowering high alcohol kind of way.
Draught at Churchkey. Aroma and taste of Jack Daniels, enough to dilute the characteristics of the stout

5/VII/14 - 50cl bottle @ RBBSG III (Gent) - BB: n/a, batch #3 (2014-735) Thanks to Beuk87 for sharing the bottle!
Little cloudy dark brown to black beer, small creamy beige head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: shit load of vanilla, lots of caramel, chocolate, mocha. MF: ok carbon, full body. Taste: very sweet, caramel, lots of vanilla, chocolate. Aftertaste: bitter, little weird chemical touch, chlorine, alcohol, lots of alcohol, mocha, coffee, vanilla, caramel.

Batch 3

Big bold and a tad bit boozy but the depth of flavors keep coming on strong as it warms. Dark as the ace of spades pretty much meet everything expected for this rarity.

Cant lie I think Ale Smith brewery makes a better barrel aged Russian imperial however both are two heavy weight title contenders of which I would not take either lightly at all. both are superb 

The ABV  on this seemed much stronger than 10.8%.   Sure would like to get some more.

From trade. 500 ml bottle as Fyodors Classic, 2014 Series, Batch No. 3 (2013 RIS. Pours pitch black with a small mocha head on top. Beautiful aroma of anise, vanilla, roast, bourbon, oak, some chocolate. Oh yea. Reminds me a bit of Black Note. Flavor is roast, bourbon, dark fruits, oak, chocolate, anise, light booze, and long lasting vanilla. Really beautiful finish on this one with definite whiskey tones. The mouthfeel is medium--only slightly lacking in body in the style and would love to see the thickness ramped up a tad--with low plus carbonation and a smooth bourbon vanilla warmth down the throat. Really nice, and improves and thickens a bit as it warms. Make sure to let it sit outside the fridge for a but before drinking.

Wow!! This beer was intense. Coffee, maple, toasty flavors attack the palate. Strong presence of bourbon flavor. 13.9ABV.

Bomber at my brother's wedding. Deep prime and toffee with bourbon. Slick and boozy with a big coffee finish.

Bottle, Fyodors Classic batch 3. Pours an inky black with a bubbly tan head. Big boozy aroma, of wood, bourbon, toasted malt, dark fruits. Taste is rich, of sweet malt, brown sugar, oak, and a big bourbon foundation. Lingering sweet bourbon and wood. Very nice.

Bottle at RBSG 2014. Thx to everyone for sharing todays bottles! 2013- Batch 3
APPEARANCE:pitch black beer, small unstable beige head.
NOSE: bourbon, chocolate, alcohol, mocha, vanilla, maybe too much bourbon?
TASTE: bourbon, wood, chocolate, lots of vanilla and mocha. Very nice!

Fyodors bottle pour black with tan head. Aroma is rich roast, chocolate, oak, and bourbon. Taste is great bitter roast with a balance of oak and bourbon. a bit of alcohol on the finish, tasty, but probably not top 50 worthy.

At RBBSG 14. Pours a super dark black/brown with a tan head. The smell is bourbon, brown sugar, coffee, deep rich fruit. The taste is huge over ripe fruit, brown sugar, bourbon, vanilla, char and booze. The body is full with fine carbonation.
Fyodors Classic - Pours very dark black w/ tan. Bourbon, oak, vanilla, chocolate, and tobacco in those nose. Very rich chocolate taste w/ bourbon, oak, and dark fruits. Solid!!!
Bottle @ RBBSG, 2014. Thanks beuk87! Oily black colour, brown foam. Medium carbonation. Roasted malts, vanilla, honey and bourbon. Sweet with bitter finish. A bit too sweet.

16.9 oz bottle; Fyodors. Dark brown with tan fluff. Nose is intense fudge brownie, bourbon, raisin and dark roast. Medium to full body with a sharp tang. Taste is bourbon, dark chocolate, coffee and wood. Delicious.

500 ml. bottle sampled as Stone Fyodors Classic @ RBBSG III. Thanks to beuk87! Black, thick solid mocha head, gorgeous. Nose is very thick bourbon, molasses, very thick syrupy, warming, black chocolate, light integrated liquorish, super thick. Very thick taste molasses bourbon, warming, rich syrupy goodness, integrated roast, liquorish, very unified black sugar, thick, very thick coffee, warming. Amazing, spectacular beer, wowza.

50cl, at 13.9%Vol, as Stone 2014 Series Batch 3 Fyodors Classic, new exclusive American brew Anno 2014, thx alot to Secret Santa!, very complex Stout, roasted/alcoholic and slightly spicy/woody, yet not too heavy, balanced, hazy, good head, very good brew, yet very expensive!, WOW!

Taste is buttery , vanilla , sweet , bit bitter , chocolaty , very intence woody vanilla ending . Hint to high carbo , but for the rest freaking perfect . Finaly , stone, you live up and acceed the hype . Damn damn nice ! 
Big thnx to torino for this one !

Bottle: Thanks Stawn: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Black beer with a medium sized brown head.
Aromas of bourbon, roast, some cream, some vanilla, marzipan...

Aftertaste is a mix of bitters, malt roast, bay leaf, coffee and some bourbon ish notes.

text: Damn! Pours a silky black color with two fingers of dark khaki foam. Big bourbon notes mingle with soft liquid chocolate, dark chocolate covered mounds bar with bourbon glaze in a glass! Beautiful integration of sweet chocolate and round bourbon complexity... This beer is delicious and words cannot due it justice. Soft silky. Damn!

Bottle at DTE tasting thanks to Chris. Opaque black pour with thin brown foam. Aroma of intense, sweet, vanilla bourbon, rich chocolate aromas, light anise, molasses. Taste is sweet, bourbony, lots of wood, vanilla, molasses, nice roasty finish, a bit sweet. Palate is med-full bodied, a bit light, med carbonation. Very nice imperial stout, a bit heavy on the bourbon.

Bottle @ tht Aroma is big vanilla, oak, chocolate, light roast and liquorice, molasses and more. Flavour is coffee infused with huge bourbon, not just vanilla, but actual bourbon, with some alcohol as well. Also chocolate, roast, liquorice and more. Awesome. Thanks Chris!

Bottle @ DTE tasting shared by kermis. Opaque pitch black color, medium sized brown head. Aroma is so so lovely: roasted malts, roast, lots of bourbon. Taste malts, roasted malts, loads of bourbon, alcohol, bitter, lightly vanilla, hint of toffee and molasses. Aroma is great, taste is good, texture is thinner than I had expected, but still a lovely beer.

Bottle shared at the DTE tasting thanks to trade with Alen. Pours near black with a small brown head. Aroma of bourbon upfront, big vanilla, fudge, roast, milk chocolate, and coffee. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter. Mouthfeel could be a little thicker which lets it down slightly, but still excellent. Full bodied with soft carbonation.
At DYE tasting. Poured deep dark brown with a frothy beige head. Aroma of vanilla smoothness, roast malt, light smooth berries. Medium to full body, flavour as the aroma,lightly bitter.

Bottle at the DTE tasting, Den Haag, courtesy of Kermis. Poured a deep mahogany with a thin tan head. The aroma is rich roasted malt, boozy alcohol and molasses. The flavour is strong bitter with a strong rich creamy malt alcoholic bitter palate. Full bodied with soft carbonation and a rich oily mouthfeel. A superb beer that fully justifies its rating.

50cl bottle shared @THT courtesy of Kermis, big thanks!
Thin creamy tan head. Clear black pour. Bourbon notes. Very smooth. A lovely beer. Every sip was a delight. Awesome!

bottle shared by samg, thanks dude! pours very dark brown with a small and reviving dark crema, some lacing. burnt hazelnuts, nicely roasted malts, some charred malts too, well integrated bourbon - never overdone, sweet cacao nibs and tobacco leaves, molasses, resin, pepper, warming booze. low carbonation, medium to full body - oily and a bit sticky, bold bitter coffee-resinous finish. much enjoyed!
Black pour, tan head, high carb. Nose is initially of sewage, vegetal. Chocolate and bourbon barrel as it warms up. Taste is fudge sundae, bourbon, oak. Medium-full silky palate.

500 ml bottle. A huge thanks to Jesse for sending this my way! This beer is now called "Fyodors Classic", and vintage is 2013s IRS aged in bourbon barrels. Presented in a handsome cork and cage 500 ml bottle with a beautiful artistic rendition of St. Basils Cathedral in Moscow behind the name of the beer. This is part of Stones "Quingenti Millilitre 2014 Series", and is named for Fyodor Dostoyevsky, "one of the greatest, most influential novelists of Russias Golden Age."

And on to the beer. Pours a nearly pitch black with a thick rocky chocolate brown head comprised of various sized bubbles. This diminished fairly quickly, leaving sparse lacing and a small-bubble trace of head. Light passes as deep crimson hues on the glass when backlit, but only at the rim of the glass. 

Aroma is big and somewhat boozy - Chocolate, bourbon, oak, roasted malt and char. I am reminded of the complex roasty sweet aromas of a campfire. 

Flavor is gigantic and warming: Giant bourbon upfront, bittersweet chocolate, oak and vanilla sweetness. Alcohol is present, but isnt bothersome. The flavors are intensified by the warming alcohol. Thin to medium bodied, roasty, bitter finish. Outstanding and world class.
From a 50 cl bottle shared at home. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of bourbon. Flavors of bourbon, oak, dark plums, and caramel. Viscous and oily mouthfeel. Smooth, roasty finish. Sublime.

Bottle 500ml [Classic 2014] Thx SamG.
Pours pitch black with low beige head. Good lacing. Aroma is of caramel, alcohol, malt, sugar, barley sugar, molasses, bourbon. Taste is of caramel, alcohol (warming), molasses, bourbon. Palate: Full bodied, light carbonation. Overall: Very good. Tasty. Nice malt features.

Bottle shared by SamGenest, thanks! Pours a dark brown with a low head that leaves some lacing. Nose is of bourbon, coconut, vanilla roasted malt and hot alcohol. Taste is indeed hot and slightly oxidized to my palate, offer caramel and bourbon notes. Alcohol gets a lot distracting after a while. Body is full, carbonation moderate and mouthfeel sticky and thick. Good overall but they could have made it a smaller beer no problem. Without all that booze it woulf have been awesome.

Heavy bottle (500 ml) labeled as Fyodors Classic 2014.. Shared by Sam, thanks! Black with a low brown head and little to no lacing. Aroma is quite complex with bourbon, fruity notes, vanilla, boozy notes, oak, chocolate and roasted malt. Taste is also of bourbon along molasses, vanilla, oak, chocolate, roasted malt, light fruitiness and alcohol. Full bodied. Moderate carbonation. Somewhat oily mouthfeel. Warming finish. Very good RIS. Quite complex. Not too hot despite the warming alcohol presence. Tasty. I think I still prefer the regular Stone RIS.

APPEARANCE: Pours like oil, slow and thick, pitch black in color, leaves a good size espresso colored head that leaves little lacing around the glass, when you look at this beer you feel like you are staring into an abyss!

AROMA: Tons of chocolate, booze, bourbon, some anise, tobacco, caramel, and vanilla. This beer makes its presence known once you pop the cork! The best part about the aroma to this beer is that it is strong and does not fade, most other stouts have a smell that becomes faint after a minute or two of pouring, but this one is brash and in your face the whole time! Its superb!

TASTE: Woah... Upfront there is loads of bourbon mixed with a perfect amount of booze, in the middle you get an awesome amount of chocolate, vanilla, a little anise, and caramel, then on the finish you get everything from the beginning and middle all perfectly mixed together with an addition of a hint of tobacco and hop bitterness, as it goes down you get a nice warmth from the booze. This beer is pretty well balanced with the characteristics that can make it unenjoyable, but for things that it needs plenty of to make it outstanding, and it has plenty of those ingredients! Superb transitions of flavors, and it gets even smoother as it warms as well! Definitely one of the best barrel aged stouts I have had!

OVERALL: Phenomenal beer from Stone! I wish I can get my hands on more of these! You have to try this!

Serving type: bottle

Finally! An enormous thank you to GT2 for alerting me that this beer was in the market. Thank to RussianDragon and Jesse for hooking me up with a bunch of these. you guys are awesome.

The beer is near black with a thick, oily, beige head. Sparse lacing. The aroma offers big bourbon and oak notes, with chocolate and roast. Sweet chocolate with a grandiose bourbon presence. Sweetness is calmed by a graceful alcoholic warmth in the finish. A delightful beer to sip. At near 14%, I can make this last the duration of the hockey game (Blackhawks vs. Kings game 7). Go Hawks! Overall, an outstanding beer and top notch example of the style.
500ml bottle from Oceanside Stone shop. Batch 03, 2013. Jet Black with small tan head. Big chocolate aromas mixed with Bourbon. Chocolate milkshake flavors balanced with smooth Bourbons. Damn good!

Bottle acquired via trade with Im908! Has all the looks of The regular version...dark Hersheys syrup pour, creamy texture, dense tiny bubbles of liquid chocolate coat the top of the brew. Aroma is of fudge, brownie batter, oak, vanilla, and subtle bourbon. The bourbon is a bit more pronounced in the flavor and melds well with the base beer. Melts on the palate. A really good beer but top 50?

What could be more perfect than one of the finest RISs in the world, finally available in a bourbon-barrel aged release? This lives up to the expectations. Enough said.

12th May 2014Tasting at Bruces pad. Big thanks to Colin for hauling this tasty morsel back to the nest. Opaque black - brown beer, good tan head. Palate is soft and airy with fine carbonation. Smooth airy dark malts with nice dark chocolate. Bourbon spice, fairly pokey, little dried fruits. Very mellow coffee, touch of coconut. More spicy bourbon in the finish and lingering on. Very solid and nice BA Stout but its too spicy and not outstanding enough to warrant its top 50 position.

500 ml bottle (Fyodors Classic 2013 IRS) poured into a Belgian snifter. Another hard to remove cork from Stone. Pours jet black with just over a finger of tan head. Aromas of bourbon, dark chocolate, vanilla, oak, coconut. Tasting notes bourbon, dark chocolate, roast, caramel, coffee, oak, booze, subtle dark fruit. Medium-full body with a dry finish. Low carbonation, slightly oily and syrupy mouthfeel.

Bottle split at Jack the Slapper tasting, acquired from Liberty Station, 12/05/14 as Fyodors Classic.
Black with a moderately appointed dirty tan swirl that soon fucks right off and teases from the edge.
Nose is coconut shavings, good old Bounty Bar, bourbon tones, light spice, rich dark chocolate, mellow dark fruit tang.

text: Bottle @ Jack the Sipper Tasting. Deep brown with a tight head. Smooth bourbon, roasted wood and dark chocolate bitterness. Marshmallow. Bitter coffee, roasted earthiness. Pretty robust, but balanced and quite drinkable. Smooth and oily, big fat body. Nice.

Bottle shared in London - many thanks to Colin, again! Pours thick black-brown with a frothy beige head. Good aroma, suggestive of good depth, some dark chocolate, strong roast, brownies, dark fruits. Medium to big sweet flavor with light alcohol kick, dark chocolate, some scorched earth, burnt wood, burnt toffee. Full bodied with fine, creamy carbonation. Warming finish with lots of bittersweet chocolate, lasting roast, charred wood. Good stuff.

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2014 Bottle massive thanks to the somewhat racist Colin Bois. It pours near black with a minimal tan head. The nose is rich roast, cocoa, earth, Reisen chocolate chew, treacle, rocky road, marshmallow and burnt caramel. Bottled as Fyodors Classic. My boss would call it Fidos. Its funny how great mind think alike. I pulled this out of the fridge, drank, went to rate and @beechner224 just ticked like a champion. Pours dark, thin khaki head that reduces to a cap. Smoky bourbon nose, booze. Taste is very bourbon based, slight chocolate, vanilla. Body is solid, booze burn lingers.

Bottle (Fyodor Alias). Huge thanks to Justin. Poured into snifter. Aroma is prominently chocolate with some booze. Pitch black with a minimal brown head. Taste is reminiscent of bourbon balls. Lots of chocolate, lots of booze. Not a ton of alcohol warning but some. Definitely doesnt taste as high as it is. Very good.
Bottle share thanks Homer. Pours black with minimal head. Aroma of sweet malt and mild bourbon. Taste is sweet, not strong chocolate or coffee, it warms going down.

Bottle - thanks GT2! Pours opaque black with a very small dark brown head that leaves decent lacing. Aroma is quite lovely, bourbon forward with chocolate and vanilla notes. Medium sweet and light plus bitter, strong bourbon, oak, vanilla and chocolate again. Medium light body, a bit creamy perhaps. Quite hot. A bit too bourbon forward and a bit too light on the body to be perfect, but pretty darn good.

Bottle shared with bytemesis. Black with small brown head. Sweet cherry bourbon aroma. Similar flavor, tootsie roll, some roasty bitterness, quite hot. Nice attempt, better than the regular IRS, a little too wild though.

Bottle. Jet black with a thin tan head. Aroma is chocolate, bourbon, wood and booze. Taste is pretty much perfect. Chocolate, bourbon, barrel, Belgian waffles with syrup and butter and moderate fusel burn. Thick sticky mouthfeel. Textbook barrel aged imperial stout. Love it.

Bottle. Unbelievable overall. Black. Aroma of bourbon, oak, dark chocolate, and coffee. The taste adds caramel, rich roasted malts, charred oak, vanilla, dark cherry... and more. Very very complex but perfectly balanced. Completely hidden 13.9%. Love this! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0.5l bottle as Fyodors Classic. Black body, brown head. Aroma of brandy, oak and chocolate. Taste of caramel, dry sherry, chocolate, vanilla and cocoa. Thick body. Big beer, thats for sure. Awesome!

Night and day with the Mikhails Odd. I dont understand how this one is so much better. Bottle thanks to csteele, shared at pre-DLD tasting. Pours a deep dark blackish brown with a tan-brown head. Aromas of vanilla, fudge, soem caramel. Taste is sweet with some bourbon heat. Thick mouth feel.

This one poured a very dark brown wo black with a beige head. Aroma was of bourbon, light smoke, anf fudge. Flavor was similar,very mellow barrel aging, soft vanilla, oak and chocolate. All around tasty beer.
Bottle shared thanks to artmcd8. Poured black with tan head. Awesome aroma of vanilla bourbon. Very smooth thick bod. Nice balance barrel taste.

Dark as hell without a lot of head. First chocolate milk then heavy booze. Bourbon or brandy aroma and flavor. As it warmed up to the room temperature the vanilla comes out more and more. Really smooth.

500 mL bottle (2014 Fyoders Classic). Hot, bourbon-heavy aroma, but the booziness doesnt overpower the rest of the nose, which includes anise, dark chocolate syrup, light oak, and caramelized molasses. Pours a clear super-dark brown. Delicious taste of dark chocolate, burnt biscuit, moderate aged bourbon, woody oak, some vanilla bean, and a bit of cocoa powder to finish. Slightly chalky and dry palate with a thinner body than the normal IRS. A damn-fine barrel-aged beer right now (April 2014), but Im curious to see how it develops with some cellar time.

labeled as Fyodors Classic. 2014 release, opened 4/12/14. Thick, oily black pour. Fast dissipating aroma. Huge vanilla oak bourbon on the nose. Tons of caramel ,Oak and bourbon all over the aroma. Very thick. Incredible bourbon tones. Oak, vanilla, caramel, some toasted coconut type sweetness. On top of the aggressive dark chocolate of the normal IRS. Simply amazing.

50 cl. (Fyodors Classic, 2014 Series, Batch #3) Une robe profondément noire et une tête kaki qui se transforme rapidement en anneau. Le nez est très impressionnant. La définition même du mot cohésif, si je peux mavancer sur ce terrain bien subjectif. Donc, une explosion regroupée de réglisse noire, de bourbon, de biscuits au chocolat, de vanille, de raisins et de noix de coco grillée envahissent mes narines et permettent à mon hypophyse et mon hypothalamus de sécréter une très grande quantité dendorphines. Jadore cette sensation. La bouche est autant belle avec ses malts brûlés, son eau-de-vie caramélisée, ses tannins, ses grains de café fort, son chocolat, sa vanille grillée, sa mélasse épicée et ses sucres résiduels contrôlés. Leffet des composés opioïdes peptidiques endogènes ne sestompe pas. Je suis dans une zone confortable et chaque gorgée me réconforte dans ce bonheur qui cherche toujours la fuite. En bouche, le liquide est bien rond. Cette sensation soyeuse est plaisante. Les petites bulles explosives nempêchent pas ma langue dêtre longuement tapissée par ces saveurs complexes. La finale chocolatée reste longue, chaude de réglisse et lourdement poivrée par cet alcool qui est ici facilement identifiable mais aucunement regrettable. Un exemple, littéralement. Puissante mais élégante.

500 c&c from Bine & Vine. As 2013 Fyodors Classic. Pours dark brown/black with a slight tan head. Aromas of alcohol and dark malt. With Light bourbon/vanilla. Coffee. Arguably full bodied. Flavor is alcohol, chocolate, coffee, bourbon/vanilla. Mild heat burn. A bit harsh. Blast from the past.

Bottle shared by bhensonb. Pours dark brown with a thick but transient tan head and a chocolate and bourbon aroma. There is an intense chocolate, coffee and treacle flavor with a dry finish and a slight alcohol burn.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2014 new rating 2014-10-18. Same as previous rating, had it again at USA comes to Göteborg 2014. Perfection. I have to give this beer a perfect score.

Bottle named Fyodors Classic 2013 at Stone Brewing, Escondido. Pitch black beer with a beautiful lasting beige head. Malty caramel aroma, vinous, woody, barrel notes, whisky, vanilla, chocolate, cocoa powder, licorice, tar notes, nutcreme, figs, plums, raisins, citrus notes, coffee notes, toffee, some creamy notes. Malty caramel flavor, vanilla, bourbon, dark chocolate, cream, cocoa powder, licorice notes, vinous, figs, dades, notes of raisins, toffee, nutcreme, woody oaky notes, alcohol is extremely well hidden, milky, tar notes. Everything i want in a imp Stout. So many flavors, so little alcohol. I wanna get drunk on this beer tonight!

Black pour, moderate head, decent lace/retention. Note that the bottle lists as 13.8%. Aroma of chocolate, vanilla, oak, very light roast, a touch of dried fruit. Full bodied, sweet, moderate alcohol , moderate barrel character. Nice stuff, I like it a *lot* more than the non barrel aged version. Theres lots of other barrel aged imperial stouts that are better though. Unlike a few of their other BA offerings its somewhat reasonably priced at *only* $19 for 500ml instead of something dumb like $40.
Black pour with a khaki head. Nose is vanilla, bourbon wood alcohol, chewy and sticky. Great palate, super thick vanilla, wood, roasted malts, alcohol, fudge and chocolate.

Pours dark with a small brownish head that settles to a whisp. Aroma is fudge, oak, traces of vanilla and caramel, and light notes of bourbon. The taste really something great. Rich chocolate and vanilla swirl, fudge, oak, and a bit of bourbon heat to round it out. The palate is smooth, chewy, and viscous. This beer is just incredible.

Aroma of toffee, coffee beans, barrel wood, raisins, plums and faint vanilla. Pitch black appearance with a thin foam rim and nice lacing against the glass. Taste is slick molasses and coffee bean oil upfront with complex notes of milk chocolate, chocolate covered raisins, toffee, nutty malts, smoke and strong barrel wood on the palate. Finish is boozey with residual milk chocolate. Overall, very boozey with lots of bourbon coming through as it warms. The barrel notes really compliment the original brew. A rating.

This pours thick and black and with just a small ring of head. It smells like a chocolate chip and coconut cookie. Its very single mindedly bourbony but still delicious, full bodied and not too sweet. This isnt exactly breaking new ground in the bourbon barrel beer world but ti nails what its going for.
500ml bottle as Fyodors Classic. Really nice brew that is bursting with chocolate flavors

500 ml bottle from star market. Pours a dense black color with a small khaki colored head that soon recedes to a fine ring around the glass. The aroma is big and bold with black licorice, vanilla and whiskey. The taste mirrors the aroma, no surprises; big over the top anise and blackstrap flavors in the forefront. Malt base of well roasted grains, bitter walnuts and lightly accentuated by whiskey and vanilla. The palate is full, smooth and viscous with soft carbonation. Finishes long and bittersweet. Overall: Darn good RIS.

Took me FOREVER to find and try this!!! Thanks and happy birthday to Big Boss Bryan at Blue Palms. 2008 version of an instant classic and former Top 50 beer. Heavy on bourbon but not in a negative way. That full coffee/baker's chocolate blend of Stone IRS with a bit less of the silkiness. Very simple beer - not complex at all but quite good.
Bottle pour of Fyodors Classic! Absolutely mind blowing! This 14% barrel aged IRS beauty is euphoric! Loads of bourbon and melted smoked chocolate resonate all over on this fine brew. Cheers!

Bottle that Mes & Sim brought along to share at Merton Beer Festival, big thanks! Shared with Thomas, Fin, Loz etc Friday 28th February 2014  Pours pitch black with tan head. Chocolate initially but then immediately tangy, wonderfully tangy,fruity and tart with a wet woodiness, you really get the actual flavours of the barrel. This is a well done and very interesting imperial stout. Many thanks to Mes & Sim  A7 A4 T9 P4 Ov16 4.0

Dark brown in a small glass, this beer has a medium-brown head and a very soft aroma, as it should. Light and smooth with a touch of chocolate, its classy with hints of anise and/or other spices present in the nose. Its light in the mouth and still retains quite a great amount of flavor over all these years. If this ages any longer Im thinking its going to start losing some of its great flavor profile. Otherwise, it almost, simply, tastes like a Russian Imperial Stout cut down to two-thirds of its original potency. So this is what happens to IRS when it ages! Definite barrel characteristics are present, but theyre not too woody the beer was carefully aged in that barrel. Theres nothing like a bourbon barrel aged beer, and this is very much a well-done one. The finish is very clean and smooth, almost a little empty. But the residual flavor is almost ghostly in character, with cocoa and some faint hints of liquor. Alcohol itself, though, is not present at all, allowing for a truly beautiful experience.
2008 vintage - poured from a bomber into tasting glass. Aroma of wood and vanilla. Lots of bourbon kills the taste of the beer (while I really like the straight Stone RIS), which is a bit of a pity.

2008, on tap at brouwers. Aroma of dark fruit, bourbon, molasses, chocolate. Deep dark color, still surface, small ring of bubbles, some irregular lacing. Taste: dark fruit, chocolate, nice roast bitterness, bourbon, some nicely placed oxidation (I think - if not oxidation, let's call it " old aged beeriness"). Slick texture, full body, decent carbonation. Overall: this is quite nice, even after 5 years.

(Critique chaotique du extreme beer fest 2013): Cuvee 2008! Tout ce que jentends dans mon recorder cest cream jeans! Cream jeans! Cream jeans!

2008 onStone Draft at Union Jacks Manatawny.  Pours black with little head,  nose is big bourbon, oak, black malt &I slight leather. first sip is luxurious black malt, bourbon, oak, pancake syrup from the diner. finish is dark chocolate, coco and leather. awesome. another whale well worth it.

I will start by assuming this went bad...a 2010 beer tapped in Jan 13.  Chocolatey tart aroma.  A skunked beer with a sour edge.  A light bourbon-stout aromas, but a clear tartness to it. Black in color with no head.


Notes:  Aces and Ales Winter Beer Fest 13

Draft to snifter (2008 vintage).  Looks good; black with razor-thin mocha lacing.  Smells good too; sweet, mellow, and malty with a nice, smooth bourbon presence.  Tastes like it smells with a wonderfully smooth mouthfeel that can likely be attributed to both the barreling and the aging.  Outstanding beer!

Sample at Jungle Jims Barrel Aged Tasting, from a 2008 vintage keg. Dark brown but still clear color. Thin light brown / tan head. Even spread of dotty lace. Great bourbon, roasty vanilla nose. Very smooth texture, pretty creamy. Light carbonation, dry texture. Great bourbon aftertaste, hits you in waves that you can cherish and savor. Good sweet, light bitter taste. Light alcohol does wonders to propel the fantastic aroma out. Very good.

Sample at Finnegans 08 Vintage 4/3/10 (Stone Beer Week)-Pours black with tan head. Aroma of bourbon and vanilla. Taste of the same with sweetness added in. This full bodied brew had a nice balance and was simply awesome.

On tap at Rackhouse Pub this was 2010 IRS aged in a Stranahans whiskey barrel but I put it here anyway. Dark black and had the most minimal tan head, like a millimeter or so. Smells like whiskey and roasted grain reminiscent of the regular IRS aged for awhile. The taste is really, really good, whiskey, wood, roasted grain, so different than the regular IRS which is already a good beer. This is very strong but I was very pleased that I ordered it.

Serving type: on-tap

Beer number two for me at GABF 2012. This 2008 vintage pours black with a mocha colored head of foam with sort of tan looking swirls here and there.  The aroma is rich, sweet, smooth and bourbony to go along with dark roasted malts and a sense of spicy black licorice in the background. The taste is similar with a solid degree of smooth bourbon surrounded thinly by dark roasted malts and a pleasing sense of chocolate. This is rich and sweet and not fully bourbony and has  a pleasing balance.

Sampled at GABF.  Pours an opaque black with some creamy, beige head.  Nose of chocolate milk, vanilla, coconut, woody, caramel, awesome.  Sweet flavor, malty, vanilla, chocolate, woody.  Great barrel character.  Super smooth and completely drinkable.  Awesome.  This has aged perfectly.  The epitome of balance.

A rare treat from a friend indeed.  Thank you very much.    Sat in appartment in San Diego, enjoyed with the setting sun over the coronado bridge.  

Slept well that night!.

GABF 2012, this was 2008 version 
Appearance: Pitch black with a small tan head 
Aroma of dark roast, bourbon, vanilla and oak 
Taste of bourbon, vanilla, oak, woody and molasses 
This was great, went back for multiple samples of this. Smooth and very easy drinking.

On tap in Denver for GABF 2012. Multiple samples of the 2008! Pours a totally black color with a small greyish head. A great nose of big bourbon and vanilla. The flavor is a massive Impy with roast, chocolate, bourbon, heat, some vanilla and lingering bitter and sweet bites. Big bourbon for sure, but balanced and drinkable despite the heat. Awesome!
Dark black  pour.  Small, but dark creamy head.  High alcohol.  Dark chocolate caramel flavor.   A really nice beer.

A: Chocolate, bourbon, alcohol, wood, and roast. P:black with red highligts and a thin head. T: bourbon and alcohol, dark chocolate, nuts, oak and finishes rather bitter. M: medium with low carbonation. O: i preffer the base, it is a good beer but the alcohol was kind of a punch

At the Strong Beer Fest at Aces and Ales. Love the aroma that climbs from the black depths of this beer. Bourbon, oak, toast and vanilla are exquisite. Alcohol and fruit are a welcome mix. Roasted malt base supports the alcohol and finishes dry and firm.

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2014 Bottle.  Dark brown/black pour.  Chocolate covered berry aromas.  Definitely infected.  Sour berry notes invade the rich dark chocolate, deep roasted malts, and bourbon flavors.  I can see the potential here and would very much like to revisit this beer... (original rating 3.8)

Re-rate (08 vintage on tap at Stone) - Big bourbon aromas. The bourbon dominates this bear with pleasant dark roasted malt, mellow caramel, and bitter chocolate undercurrents.  Good body and mouthfeel.  Now this is what I was looking for.....

2008.  Pours dark black with no head, aroma of bourbon vanilla and sweet chocolate. Taste follows, smooth and delicious. Really, really nice

20 July 3012, bottle. 2010 release (the recalled version). Dark brown. Nose is huge sweet raisins and vanilla. 
Slight vinegar, dry oak, faint  dark chocolate. Nose is amazing, tastes great but might be faintly off.

Poured on tap at Beachwood BBQ. It is black in the glass with small head. The aroma is hard to describe, there is vanilla, coffee and alcohol. The taste matches the aroma well. Big and full of flavor. You notice the smoothness right away. There is espresso and vanilla up front. Then you taste chocolate and an alcohol punch near the end. Extremely rich and smooth.

Growler (from notes 09/11).  Pours oily jet black with a small tan head; served at 55 degrees  The aroma has dark chocolate, roast, espresso, bourbon, vanilla and a hint of anise. The flavor was a decadent blend of far chocolate, roasted malts, espresso, bourbon, vanilla and a hint of anise. Very smooth, full bodied, carries the anvil quite well.  I had this a few months earlier with a friend and was equally impressed.  I think this is a bit better than the base.
Dark black in color, clear with a thin tan head.  Big bourbon and stout aroma.  Awesome barrel ageing flavor.  Love the flavor this was a super brew.

From notes.  First reviewed 8/22/2011.  Served on tap in a snifter at Acre.

As expected, this is pitch black with just a hint of mahogany and ruby in the edges.

The aroma is full of bourbon; it is in the forefront to the point where it kind of drowns out the other wonderful smells. Molasses, dark fruits, and a bit of anise and chocolate are pushed to the periphery. 

The flavor is again a bit strong on the bourbon for me, considering that the base beer is so good. It starts strong and stays on the palate through each sip. Behind that, some molasses and vague dark fruit sweetness start out, with vanilla, oak, and roasted malt rounding out the front. The roasted malt has a tinge of burnt character and flows into a coffee bitterness nicely as the sip progresses. The finish is lightly bitter with more bourbon.

This has a dry, woody, oaky feel, which makes it feel less full bodied than the original. Medium carbonation is on the creamy side. 

If I had this on its own, it would be a fine beer. The only issue is that Stone had the audacity to make IRS so good that drowning the flavor out with bourbon is a downgrade. Some people might like the bourbon treatment to be over the top, but I prefer it to be more nuanced.
I look forward to the release of this every year, it is as always a favorite of mine. I enjoy the thickness of the beer and the finish is delightful.

Draft at Brewvival 2012. Pours pitch black with a large creamy tan head. Good head retention. Aroma of chocolate, roasted malts, raisin and whisky. The taste is roasted malts, chocolate, raisin, whisky, cocoa, caramel and a hoppy finish. Full bodied. Very nice.

On tap

The highlight of Cleveland Beer Week for me was the chance to try this elusive beer. Right up there with barrel aged versions of Dark Lord and Bourbon County Stout it ranks as a beer that everyone should try at least once. I think I might like regular RIS slightly better but it is a close call.

Aroma / Appearance - The heavy black body sits wearily at the bottom of the glass. A lively brown head imbues a good contrast as I wait for the pour to warm from 40 degrees to room temperature. Vanilla, chocolate, oak, malt, and cocoa nibs waft effortlessly towards the senses. Time has mellowed the base beer somewhat though the aging process has not produced a bourbon bomb. Anise adds some additional sweetness around the edges.

Flavor / Palate - Fresh coffee, malt, dark chocolate drizzled over a handful of licorice hard candy, and vanilla alternate the spotlight. The oak aging is soft around the edges and plays nicely with the other flavors. While it is impossible to mask an 11% ABV completely this is so smooth that it sneaks up on you only at the last minute. A world class release, I would expect no less from Stone given their track record.

2008 in Heaven Hill barrels. On draft at Lizardville for Cleveland Beer Week. Pours black with a nice thick mocha head and some great lacing. Coffee, bourbon, chocolate, toffee, vanilla are up front on the nose. I pick up some marshmellow, licorice and leather as well. What a nose on this beer. Bourbon upfront, cocoa, coffee, licorice, vanilla, with raisin and dates come through nicely in the taste. Thick and coating on the palate with a long dark roasted coffee finish and notes of bourbon.

Stranahans Whiskey Barrel Aged on tap at Rackhouse Pub, Denver.

No head.  Dark black opaque.  Lots of bourbon and oak vanilla notes, a bit of roasted dark malt.  Very well balanced.  Not a lot of the stout shows through unfortunately, but the bourbon doesnt overwhelm.  Stout carries it well, but isnt strong enough to represent itself equally.  Alcohol dangerously well integrated.  Delicious beer.  Had it with a whiskey bbq chicken sandwich with bacon-good pairing, but this would be just as good with a chocolate dessert.

On tap at The Rackhouse, Denver, 2011 GABF.  Aged in Stranahans. Very dark black with no head. Nice big aroma of chocolate, whiskey, oak, vanilla, molasses, and more chocolaty vanilla. Very smooth uncarbonated body, a little too much so. Big boozy overtones of whiskey and oak, with a sweet background of heavy roasted black malts, chocolate, vanilla, and more booze on the back of the throat. No nuance, all pizzazz. But in all, not too shabby.

Denver Rare Beer Tasting.  Stranahans barrels. Black appearance with a tiny, dark brown head. Sweet caramel, toffee, whiskey, oak, vanilla, dark chocolate malty aroma. Low carbonation. Roasty dark chocolate,  caramel, toffee, vanilla, woody, whiskey flavor. Im not too impressed.

Growler sample at JOs. Poured a black color with a minnimal frothy brown head that diminished with minimal lacing. Moderate to heavy toasted chocolate, coffee and wood bourbon aroma. Medium to heavy bourbon sweet roasted black coffee malty flavor with a heavy bittersweet and small alcohol bite finish of moderate to long duration. Full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. This is a standout beer with some age.

Had this on the eve of the August 27th JOs release. Big thanks to Jason for sharing this. 08 vintage from growler. ~4 oz from a tasting snifter.

3.5 A: Black. Pour yielded no head.

4.5 S: The barrel aging is done extremely well. The bourbon portion is perfect. Incredibly smooth with leather, melon, prune, and plum. However, the underlying stout cant stand tall alongside. Some chocolate and roast, but does not seem to have the subtleties that the regular has at this age. Still, bourbon forward or not, smells delicious.

3.5 T: I have no idea where the Stone IRS went. This tastes a bit like watered down bourbon rather than a bourbon enhanced stout. Theres just a little chocolate and a little roast. However, the bourbon itself makes this still taste great. Leather, melon, prune, and plum. Alcohol is very well hidden.

3.5 M: Medium body. Good moderate carbonation. Could be creamier though.

3.5 D: Decent, but stout that cant stand tall above barrel treatments should not be put into barrels. Im completely shocked that Stone IRS is one of these.

Serving type: growler
